gurmukhi: qU nhI jwnq hYN sun ry sT qo kh dwNqn swQ cbY hYN ]qohI ky mws ky KMfn KMf kY pwvk bwn mY BuMj kY KYhYN ]1467]
transliteration: Too Nahijaanat Hain Soun Re Sath To Kah Daantan Saath Chabai Hain|| Tohike Maas Ke Khanndan Khanndkai Paavak Baan Mai Bhounj Kai Khai-hain||1467||
translation: “O fool! you do now know that we shall chew you with our teeth; we shall roast the bits of your flesh with the fire of our arrows and devour them.”1467.

gurmukhi: XO sun kY iqh bYn ko niRp boilXo irs Kwie ]jo hm qy Bij jwie iqh mwqw dUD Apwie ]1468]
transliteration: Yau Soun Kai Tih Bain Ko Nrip Boliyo Ris Khaae|| Jo Ham Te Bhaj(i) Jaae Tih Maataa Doodh Apaae||1468||
translation: Hearing these words, the king spoke in anger, “He, who goes away safe from me, may consider that he has released himself from the bondage of milk of his mother.”1468.

gurmukhi: eyku bYn sun dwnvI sYn pry sB Dwie ]chUM Er GyirXo niRpiq Kyq bwr kI nXwie ]1469]
transliteration: Ek(u) Bain Soun Daanavisain Dare Sabh Dhaae|| Chahoon Or Gheriyo Nripat(i) Khet Baar Kinyaae||1469||
translation: Hearing these words, the demon army fell upon the king and besieged him all the four sides like the fence of the field.1469.

gurmukhi: Asurn Gyr KVg isMG lIno ]qb niRp kop Gno mn kIno ]DnK bwn kr bIc sMBwrY ]S`qR Anyk mwr hI fwrY ]1470]
transliteration: Asuran Gher Khadag Singh Leeno|| Tab Nrip Kop Ghano Man Keeno|| Dhanakh Baan Kar Beech Sanbhdarai|| Shattra Anek Maar Hiddarai||1470||
translation: When the demons besieged the king, who became extremely enraged in his mind; taking his bow and arrows in his hands, he killed many enemies.1470.

gurmukhi: kRUr krm iek rwCs nwmw ]ijn jIqy Awgy sMgRwmw ]so qb hI niRp swmuih gXo ]Aq hI jUJ duhn ko BXo ]1471]
transliteration: Kroor Karam Ik Raachhas Naamaa|| Jin Jeete Aage Sanraamaa|| So Tab Hitab Hinrip Saamuh(i) Gado|| At Hijoojhduhan Ko Bhayo||1471||
translation: There was a demon named Krurkaram, who had conquered many wars; he went before Kharag Singh and both the heroes were engaged in a terrible war.1471.

gurmukhi: AwXuD lY sB hI Apxy jb hI vh BUpiq sMg AirXo hY ]ju`D Anyk pRkwr kIXo rn kI iCq qy koaU nwih tirXo hY ]
transliteration: Ooyudh Lai Sabh Hiapne Jab Hivah Bhoopat(i) San Ariyo Hai|| Juddh Anek Prakaar Keeyo Ran Kichhit Te Ko( i)  Naah(i) Tariyo Hai||
translation: When, taking his weapons, he firmly resisted the king, he fought in many ways and no one retraced his steps from the battlefield;

gurmukhi: qO niRp lY kr mY Ais ko irp muMf kitXo igr BUm pirXo hY ]dyh CuitXo nhI kop hitXo inj ET ko dwNqn soN pkirXo hY ]1472]
transliteration: Tau Nrip Lai Kar Mai As(i) Ko Rip Mounnd Katiyo Gir Bhoom Pariyo Hai|| Deh Chhoutiyo Nahikop Hatiyo Nij Oth Ko Daantan Son Pakriyo Hai||1472||
translation: The king taking his sword in his hand, killed the enemy and his head fell on the earth; through he had breathed his last, but his anger did not subside even then; he had pressed his lip within his teeth.1472.

gurmukhi: kRUr krm ko KVg isMG jb mwirXo rn TOr ]Asurn kI sYnw huqI dwnv inkisXo AOr ]1473]
transliteration: Kroor Karam Ko Khadag Singh Maariyo Ran Thaur|| Asuran Kisainaa Houtidaanav Niksiyo Aur||1473||
translation: When Karurkaram was knocked down in the battlefield by Kharag Singh, then another demon came out of the army of demons.1473.

gurmukhi: kUr dYNq ijh nwm bfy blvMf Aiq ]Awgy bhu sMgRwm lirXy AirXy nwhn firXy ]1474]
transliteration: Kroor Daint Jih Naam Bado Daint Balvand At(i) Ooge Bahu Sanram Lariyo Ariyo Naahan Dariyo||1474||
translation: This demon named Karurdaitya was extremely powerful; he had earlier fought in several battles; he confronted the king with firmness and did not fear even slightly.1474.
